perturbation.original_text:
1.1 Definitions. For purposes of this Agreement, the following terms shall have the following meanings, and to the extent
not defined in this section or otherwise in this Agreement, a term shall have the meaning ascribed to it in any of the Other
Agreements:
Source: CONFORMIS INC, 10-Q, 11/1/2019



"Acceptance" and "Accept" have the meaning set forth in Article 3.4 of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.1 Definitions. For purposes of this Agreement, the following terms shall have the following meanings, and to the extent
not defined in this section or otherwise in this Agreement, a term shall have the meaning ascribed to it in any of the Other
Agreements. For the avoidance of doubt, any term defined within a specific article shall only apply to that article, and no other.
Source: CONFORMIS INC, 10-Q, 11/1/2019



"Acceptance" and "Accept" have the meaning set forth in Article 3.4 of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition states that terms have the meanings defined in the section or other agreements. The modified text adds a clause stating that definitions within a specific article only apply to that article. This could create confusion if a term is defined in Article 1 but used in Article 5 without being redefined.

perturbation.original_text:
8.1 Term. The term of this Agreement shall begin as of the Effective Date and continue until Acceptance of all Deliverables
for Milestones #1 and #2 pursuant to Section 3.4 and completion of Milestone #3, unless earlier terminated under Section 8.2, as
provided for under the Other Agreements, or as mutually agreed by the Parties.
perturbation.changed_text:
8.1 Term. The term of this Agreement shall begin as of the Effective Date and continue until Acceptance of all Deliverables
for Milestones #1 and #2 pursuant to Section 3.4 and completion of Milestone #3, unless earlier terminated under Section 8.2, as
provided for under the Other Agreements, or as unilaterally decided by Conformis, with written notice.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract specified termination as 'mutually agreed by the Parties'. The modified version now states the contract can be terminated 'as unilaterally decided by Conformis'. This directly contradicts the former requirement of mutual agreement, thus creating uncertainty in the legal requirements to terminate the agreement.

perturbation.original_text:
10.2 Assignment and Change of Control. Except as otherwise provided herein, a Party shall not have the right to
assign any of its rights or obligations under this Agreement (whether through a merger, sale of stock, or otherwise) without the
prior written consent of the other Party; except that, either Party shall be permitted, without any need for the other Party's
consent, to assign this Agreement (a) in whole or in part to an Affiliate (provided, however, that once such Person is no longer an
Affiliate of the assigning Party, such former Affiliate shall assign this Agreement back to the assigning Party), provided that the
assigning Party provides the other Party notice of any such assignment provided further that failure to provide such notice of such
assignment shall not render such assignment void; or (b) to a Third Party in connection with sale or transfer of all or substantially all
of the assigning Party's business or assets relating to the subject matter of this Agreement, whether by Change of Control, merger,
sale of assets or otherwise; provided, however, that, with respect to clause (b), (i) any assignment of this Agreement shall be void
and have no effect unless and until the assignee assumes the
perturbation.changed_text:
10.2 Assignment and Change of Control. Except as otherwise provided herein, a Party *shall* have the right to
assign any of its rights or obligations under this Agreement (whether through a merger, sale of stock, or otherwise) *with* the
prior written consent of the other Party; except that, either Party shall be permitted, without any need for the other Party's
consent, to assign this Agreement (a) in whole or in part to an Affiliate (provided, however, that once such Person is no longer an
Affiliate of the assigning Party, such former Affiliate shall assign this Agreement back to the assigning Party), provided that the
assigning Party provides the other Party notice of any such assignment provided further that failure to provide such notice of such
assignment shall render such assignment void; or (b) to a Third Party in connection with sale or transfer of all or substantially all
of the assigning Party's business or assets relating to the subject matter of this Agreement, whether by Change of Control, merger,
sale of assets or otherwise; provided, however, that, with respect to clause (b), (i) any assignment of this Agreement shall be void
and have no effect unless and until the assignee assumes the
perturbation.explanation: The original contract says, that a party shall *not* have the right to assign without prior consent, the modified version states the party *shall* have the right to assign, only with written consent. The original version says a failure to provide notice of the assignment shall *not* render the assignment void; whereas, the modified version states a failure to provide such notice shall render it void. These statements provide a direct contradiction.
